name: Asterix
description: A clever and brave Gaulish warrior, small but fearless.

name: Obelix
description: Asterix’s best friend, menhir-deliveryman with permanent super strength after falling into the magic potion.

name: Dogmatix
description: The small Gaulish dog, loyal to Obelix and Asterix; loves trees and is perhaps the only ‘canine ecologist’.

name: Getafix
description: The village druid, brews the magic potion that gives the Gauls their strength.

name: Vitalstatistix
description: Chief of the Gaulish village; carried around on a shield by his shield-bearers.

name: Impedimenta
description: The chief’s wife; ambitious, strong-willed and concerned with status.

name: Cacofonix
description: The village bard whose singing is notoriously terrible and leads to punishment (e.g., being tied to a tree).

name: Fulliautomatix
description: The village blacksmith; often engages in comic fights with the fishmonger Unhygienix.

name: Unhygienix
description: The village fishmonger; often uses stale fish as ammunition in fights with Fulliautomatix.

name: Bacteria
description: Wife of Unhygienix, known for her gossip and sharp tongue.

name: Geriatrix
description: The village elder; older Gaul, complains about youth and relies on his wife.

name: Mrs. Geriatrix
description: The much younger wife of Geriatrix, who keeps him in check.

name: Julius Caesar
description: Roman general and statesman; the main antagonist of the Gauls’ resistance.

name: Brutus
description: Adopted son of Caesar; appears in various volumes plotting against his father.

name: Cleopatra
description: Queen of Egypt; appears in adventures where Gauls travel to Egypt and build grand structures.

name: Crismus Bonus
description: A Roman centurion constantly frustrated by the indomitable Gauls.

name: Dubius Status
description: A corrupt Roman official involved in shady dealings.

name: Lucius Detritus
description: A manipulative Roman known for his skill at sowing discord.

name: Instantmix
description: A druid rival of Getafix who experiments with strange potions.

name: Justforkix
description: A young Gaul visiting from Lutetia, obsessed with fashion and city life.

name: Falbala
description: A beautiful young Gaulish woman admired by all the men in the village.

name: Tragicomix
description: Falbala’s handsome fiancé, a gallant warrior.

name: Oceanix
description: A fisherman who often helps Unhygienix at sea.

name: Cartographix
description: A Gaul who creates detailed maps of the region.

name: Pneumatix
description: A courier who delivers messages swiftly between villages.

name: Ecotourix
description: A Gaul fascinated by foreign lands and customs.

name: Orthopaedix
description: An innkeeper who once challenged Vitalstatistix for leadership.

name: Angine
description: Orthopaedix’s strong-willed wife who pushes her husband to seek more status.

name: Ompa
description: A young slave freed by Asterix and Obelix in Egypt.
